User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the FluxoPro application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

phoneNumber.description: The user's phone number used for login.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: Represents a financial transaction (income or expense).

id.description: Unique identifier for the Transaction entity.

value.description: The value of the transaction. Negative values represent expenses.

groupId.description: Identifier for recurring or installment transactions.

Account.title: Account
Account.description: Represents a user's account or credit card.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Account entity.

type.description: The type of account (e.g., ContaCorrente, CartaoCredito, Investimento).

limit.description: The credit limit for credit card accounts.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a user-defined category for transactions.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Category entity.

color.description: The color associated with the category in hex format (e.g., #FF0000).

CategoryColor.title: CategoryColor
CategoryColor.description: Maps a color to a category for visualization purposes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CategoryColor entity.

color.description: The color associated with the category (e.g., #FF0000).

Budget.title: Budget
Budget.description: Represents a monthly budget for a specific category.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Budget entity.

limit.description: The monthly budget limit for the category.

month.description: The month for which the budget is defined (e.g., 2024-01).

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to manage personal finances with a focus on automation, visualization, and user customization. It prioritizes authorization independence by using path-based ownership for user-specific data. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules, allowing for atomic operations and easier debugging.

*   **Users Collection:** Stores user profiles with `phoneNumber` and `createdAt` fields. The `id` is automatically generated by Firebase Authentication.
*   **User-Owned Data:** Accounts, Categories, CategoryColors, Budgets, and Transactions are stored as subcollections under the `/users/{userId}` path. This ensures that only the authenticated user can access their own data. The User ID is stored in localStorage on the client side for immediate use after login, removing any latency in obtaining the Auth ID.
*   **Authorization Independence:** All data is stored under the user's document (`/users/{userId}`). This means that access control can be enforced using path-based rules, without needing to read any data from parent documents. For example, to secure the `transactions` collection, the rule would simply check if `request.auth.uid == userId`.
*   **Homogeneous Security Posture:** The use of subcollections guarantees that all documents within a collection have the same security requirements (e.g., all documents in `/users/{userId}/transactions` can only be accessed by the user with ID `userId`).
*   **Support for QAPs:**
    *   List operations are secured by path-based rules ensuring that a user can only list data under their own user ID.
    *   The consistent use of path-based ownership and the elimination of `get()` calls in security rules contribute to a robust and secure data access model.

This structure facilitates clear and concise security rules, enhances maintainability, and provides a solid foundation for building a feature-rich financial management application.
